descr: "A formal agreement between parties regarding the conduct of business, exchange of information or other matters."

fields.name: identifier
fields.descr: "Unique identifier for this particular Contract Provision."

fields.name: applies
fields.descr: "Relevant time or time-period when this Contract Provision is applicable."

fields.name: type
fields.descr: "Type of Contract Provision such as specific requirements, purposes for actions, obligations, prohibitions, e.g. life time maximum benefit."

fields.name: subType
fields.descr: "Subtype of this Contract Provision, e.g. life time maximum payment for a contract term for specific valued item, e.g. disability payment."

fields.name: topic
fields.descr: "The matter of concern in the context of this provision of the agrement."

fields.name: actionReason
fields.descr: "Reason or purpose for the action stipulated by this Contract Provision."

fields.name: securityLabel
fields.descr: "A set of security labels that define which terms are controlled by this condition."

fields.name: agent
fields.descr: "An actor taking a role in an activity for which it can be assigned some degree of responsibility for the activity taking place."

fields.name: text
fields.descr: "Human readable form of this Contract Provision."

fields.name: modifierExtension
fields.descr:
"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions."
 derived from BackboneElement

fields.name: id
fields.descr:
"unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces."
 derived from Element
 derived from BackboneElement

fields.name: extension

Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension."
